pullrequest.title: Add RPYXYZ parser for projector pose

content.raw:
To reproduce, I installed `ros-indigo-gazebo5-ros-pkgs` and made a catkin workspace with [pr2_simulator](https://github.com/PR2/pr2_simulator) and [pr2_common](https://github.com/PR2/pr2_common):
~~~
mkdir -p pr2_ws/src
cd pr2_ws/src
git clone https://github.com/PR2/pr2_common -b indigo-devel
git clone https://github.com/PR2/pr2_simulator -b hydro-devel
~~~
~~My pull request hasn't been merged yet, so that needs to be pulled in:~~ 
~~
cd pr2_ws/src/pr2_common
git pull https://github.com/scpeters/pr2_common issue_223
~~
The PR has now been merged so the previous step is not needed.

Then source a ros setup file and build:
~~~
cd pr2_ws
. /opt/ros/indigo/setup.bash
catkin_make install
~~~
Then load pr2 in an empty world and the projectors will point behind the robot instead of forward.
~~~
cd pr2_ws
. install/setup.bash
roslaunch pr2_gazebo pr2_empty_world.launch
~~~
content.html:
To reproduce, I installed ros-indigo-gazebo5-ros-pkgs and made a catkin workspace with pr2_simulator and pr2_common:

mkdir -p pr2_ws/src
cd pr2_ws/src
git clone https://github.com/PR2/pr2_common -b indigo-devel
git clone https://github.com/PR2/pr2_simulator -b hydro-devel

My pull request hasn't been merged yet, so that needs to be pulled in: cd pr2_ws/src/pr2_common git pull https://github.com/scpeters/pr2_common issue_223 The PR has now been merged so the previous step is not needed.

Then source a ros setup file and build:

cd pr2_ws
. /opt/ros/indigo/setup.bash
catkin_make install

Then load pr2 in an empty world and the projectors will point behind the robot instead of forward.

cd pr2_ws
. install/setup.bash
roslaunch pr2_gazebo pr2_empty_world.launch
